eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PixelPerfectMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Grid-based or pixel perfect platformer and top-down movements.
description: Games with pixel art usually use pixels bigger than actual pixels of the screen. This can lead to big pixels partially overlapping each other which doesn't look good.
This extension allows to seamlessly keep big pixels aligned when the object is stopped and still beneficiate from the high resolution of the screen to have smooth movements.
* Align top-down characters on a grid ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsFunctions.description: Return the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedToReach
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: BrakingDistance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a top-down movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectTopDownMovement

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a platformer character movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectPlatformerCharacter

events.comment: We don't know if the deceleration was already applied or not this step, but if the speed drifted from more than 1%, another extension is probably modifying the speed and it must not be overridden.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

Check if the character is decelerating.
It's done in doStepPostEvent because there is no way to know if the doStepPreEvents of this behavior is executed before or after the one of PlatformerCharcter.
As TimeDelta is used, we have to be sure the last PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents call used the same TimeDelta. Which means this must be done after PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents.
Save the speed to detect speed changes from outside.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IdleTracker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check if an object has not moved (with some, customizable, tolerance) for a certain duration (1 second by default).
description: This behavior tracks the object position and provides a condition to check if the object has been around the same position for a certain amount of time. It's useful to track objects that are not moving (or very little, at least staying around a position).
* Add the behavior to your object.
* Configure the distance tolerance and the amount of time before considering objects idle.
* Use the conditions in your events to know when the object is idle (or when it has just moved).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Check if an object has not moved (with some tolerance, 20 pixels by default) for a certain duration (1 second by default).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: IdleTracker

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has just moved from its last position (using the tolerance configured in the behavior).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Has just moved from last position
eventsFunctions.name: HasMovedFromLastPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ has moved from its last position

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is idle: it has not moved from its last position (or within the tolerance) for the time configured in the behavior.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

propertyDescriptors.label: Time, in seconds, before considering the object as idle
propertyDescriptors.name: DurationBeforeIdle

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance, in pixels, allowed for the object to travel and still be considered idle
propertyDescriptors.name: IdleDistanceTolerance
